meaning: A room, building, piece of land etc that is adjacent to something is next to it.
Used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said.
If you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose.
If a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged.
Someone you work with â€“ used especially by professional people.
To make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc.
To imagine a particular situation or to think about something in a particular way.
To make someone feel certain that something is true.
To make someone feel very unhappy.
To experience something, especially problems or opposition.
Very big in size or in amount.
A forthcoming event, meeting etc is one that has been planned to happen soon.
If a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion.
The quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right.
Being part of the nature or character of someone or something.
If you invoke a law, rule etc, you say that you are doing something because the law allows or forces you to.
To officially say that people must pay a tax or charge.
In the same way.
In spite of the fact that has just been mentioned.
In spite of something.
